description: We designed and implemented a mixed-methods monitoring and evaluation strategy for the Brief Intervention with Motivational Interviewing (IBEM) program in Zacatecas.

We partnered with Red PaPaz to evaluate two key initiatives on child protection and public awareness. First, we assessed the NetSmartz Workshop, a program to prevent child abuse. Second, we evaluated a national media campaign.

We evaluated 10 public service announcements aimed at improving motorcycle driver safety. Through 12 virtual focus groups, we assessed message clarity, emotional impact, cultural relevance, and potential for behavior change.

We conducted an external evaluation of the Transformative Public Leadership Program, which aimed to strengthen local leadership and build trust between Grupo de Energía de Bogotá and communities in Cogua, Machetá, and Suesca.

We partnered with Sesame Workshop to support the social and emotional integration of Venezuelan migrant children and host communities in Colombia. This collaboration included needs assessments and a formative evaluation of Hola Sésamo.

In collaboration with Centro Imagina at Universidad de los Andes, we supported the outcome evaluation of a community-based intervention led by ARUP and Fundación Tiempo de Juego, aimed at creating safer and more inclusive urban spaces.
